### Self-Study Exercises

| Title                                                                                                                         | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Organizer                                                                                                                 |
|----------------------|------------------------------------|-------------------|
| [Digital Epidemiology Workshop](https://cgps-group.github.io/digitalepiworkshop/hands-on/exercise.html)                       | Hands on exercise using web-based tools (EpiCollect, Pathogenwatch, Data-flo, Microreact) to conduct a genomic epidemiology investigation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [Centre for Genomic Pathogen Surveillance](pathogensurveillance.net)                                                      |
| [Infectious Disease Genomic Epidemiology 2023](https://bioinformaticsdotca.github.io/IDE_2023)                                | This 4-day course from CBW provides an introduction to genomic epidemiology analysis followed by hands-on practical tutorials demonstrating the use of selected analysis tools. The tutorials are designed as self-contained units that include example data and detailed instructions for installation of all required bioinformatics tools or access to publicly available web applications.        | [Bioinformatics.ca](bioinformatics.ca)                                                                                    |
| [Whole genome multi locus sequence typing activity](https://cals.cornell.edu/new-york-integrated-food-safety/wgmlst-activity) | This activity was developed by the New York Integrated Food Safety Center of Excellence to provide public health staff or students of public health with an understanding of how whole genome sequencing (WGS), and particularly whole genome multi locus sequence typing (wgMLST), works as a subtyping method. The activity can be taken individually or in group (3-5 people per group suggested). | [New York Food Safety Center of Excellence/ Cornell University](https://cals.cornell.edu/new-york-integrated-food-safety) |
| [Bioinformatics for Genomic Epidemiology March 2024](https://pathogen-genomics-march-2024.sanbi.ac.za/)                       | An introductory course on Pathogen Bioinformatics for Genomic Epidemiology. Topics covered include Introduction Unix/Linux, command line, shell scripting, containers, Galaxy, Nextflow, R, and a cholera case study.                                                                                                                                                                                 | [SANBI](https://www.sanbi.ac.za/) (the South African National Bioinformatics Institute                                    |

### **Other resources for genomic epidemiology in public health**

------------------------------------------------------------------------

-   **An applied genomic epidemiological handbook.** by Alli Black and Gytis Dudas, freely available online [here](https://alliblk.github.io/genepi-book/), and available in print [here](https://www.taylorfrancis.com/books/edit/10.1201/9781003409809/applied-genomic-epidemiology-handbook-allison-black-gytis-dudas).

-   **Wellcome Connecting Science** offers a variety of genomics and bioinformatics courses through [FutureLearn](https://www.futurelearn.com/partners/wellcome-genome-campus)
